title: Having a family is expensive. Here's what Harris and Trump have said about easing costs
US elections: Trump reposts a vulgar remark about Kamala Harris on social media, sparks row
content: Donald Trump took to Truth Social to repost a crude remark about Vice President Kamala Harris, suggesting she advanced her career through sexual favors, referencing her past relationship with Willie Brown. This post sparked criticism for its explicit nature and added to Trump's history of sexist attacks against political opponents, reflecting his controversial behavior.
summary: Donald Trump took to Truth Social to repost a crude remark about Vice President Kamala Harris, suggesting she advanced her career through sexual favors, referencing her past relationship with Willie Brown. This post sparked criticism for its explicit nature and added to Trump's history of sexist attacks against political opponents, reflecting his controversial behavior.

title: 'Target of opportunity': FBI discloses shooter's plan to assassinate Donald Trump
content: The FBI disclosed that Thomas Matthew Crooks, a 20-year-old from Pennsylvania, attempted to assassinate former US President Donald Trump during a rally in Butler. Engaging in detailed planning, Crooks targeted the rally as an opportune event. Trump was grazed by a bullet before Secret Service snipers neutralized the attacker with an AR-style rifle found on the scene.
summary: The FBI disclosed that Thomas Matthew Crooks, a 20-year-old from Pennsylvania, attempted to assassinate former US President Donald Trump during a rally in Butler. Engaging in detailed planning, Crooks targeted the rally as an opportune event. Trump was grazed by a bullet before Secret Service snipers neutralized the attacker with an AR-style rifle found on the scene.

title: JD Vance blasts Kamala Harris over Afghanistan withdrawal: 'She can go to hell'
content: At a rally in Erie, Pennsylvania, Senator JD Vance strongly condemned Vice President Kamala Harris, blaming her for the deaths of 13 American service members during the 2021 Afghanistan withdrawal. He criticized her lack of action and accountability, accusing her of shifting blame onto Donald Trump instead of addressing the issues head-on. Neither Trump nor Harris campaigns have responded yet.
summary: At a rally in Erie, Pennsylvania, Senator JD Vance strongly condemned Vice President Kamala Harris, blaming her for the deaths of 13 American service members during the 2021 Afghanistan withdrawal. He criticized her lack of action and accountability, accusing her of shifting blame onto Donald Trump instead of addressing the issues head-on. Neither Trump nor Harris campaigns have responded yet.

title: US elections: Harris and Walz's bus tour - VP and running mate visit Georgia in bid to sway GOP strongholds
content: Vice President Kamala Harris and Tim Walz visited Liberty County High School, Georgia as part of their campaign tour. Harris interacted with students and encouraged them. They also stopped at a local restaurant. The campaign aims to connect with traditionally Republican areas and secure a victory in the battleground state ahead of the November election.
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris and Tim Walz visited Liberty County High School, Georgia as part of their campaign tour. Harris interacted with students and encouraged them. They also stopped at a local restaurant. The campaign aims to connect with traditionally Republican areas and secure a victory in the battleground state ahead of the November election.

title: International students cannot follow master’s courses owing to poor English: Report
content: An anonymous blog by two professors at Russell Group universities reveals that a significant number of international students in the UK fall short of the required English skills to earn their degrees, yet they still receive them. This challenge predominantly impacts master’s programs and threatens the global reputation of UK's higher education.
summary: An anonymous blog by two professors at Russell Group universities reveals that a significant number of international students in the UK fall short of the required English skills to earn their degrees, yet they still receive them. This challenge predominantly impacts master’s programs and threatens the global reputation of UK's higher education.

title: Telegram's Durov probed for 'serious' violence against his child in France: Reports
content: Pavel Durov, the founder and chief of Telegram, who was arrested in France on charges of failing to curb illegal content on the app, is also being investigated on suspicion of "serious acts of violence" against one of his children, a source close to the case said Wednesday. On Wednesday evening, Durov was charged by the French judiciary with a litany of violations related to the messaging app but allowed to go free while being banned from leaving the country.
summary: Pavel Durov, the founder and chief of Telegram, who was arrested in France on charges of failing to curb illegal content on the app, is also being investigated on suspicion of "serious acts of violence" against one of his children, a source close to the case said Wednesday. On Wednesday evening, Durov was charged by the French judiciary with a litany of violations related to the messaging app but allowed to go free while being banned from leaving the country.

title: Bangladesh interim govt revokes Sheikh Hasina's ban on Jamaat-e-Islami
content: Bangladesh's interim government has lifted the ban on Jamaat-e-Islami and its student wing, Islami Chhatra Shibir, asserting no involvement in terrorist activities. The ban, enforced by the Awami League government, has been revoked due to insufficient evidence. Jamaat's leader criticized the Awami League for institution destruction ahead of national polls.
summary: Bangladesh's interim government has lifted the ban on Jamaat-e-Islami and its student wing, Islami Chhatra Shibir, asserting no involvement in terrorist activities. The ban, enforced by the Awami League government, has been revoked due to insufficient evidence. Jamaat's leader criticized the Awami League for institution destruction ahead of national polls.

title: Ukraine intent on keeping Russian territory, US intelligence official says
US elections: Tulsi Gabbard, Robert Kennedy and Trump's 'Game of Thrones'
content: Donald Trump plans to name Tulsi Gabbard and Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as honorary co-chairs of his presidential transition team. Both are former Democratic presidential candidates who recently endorsed Trump. This move echoes Trump's broader tactic of incorporating former opponents into his circle to secure political advantage and loyalty.
summary: Donald Trump plans to name Tulsi Gabbard and Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as honorary co-chairs of his presidential transition team. Both are former Democratic presidential candidates who recently endorsed Trump. This move echoes Trump's broader tactic of incorporating former opponents into his circle to secure political advantage and loyalty.

title: US elections: Trump and Harris set for high-stakes showdown in first presidential debate - What we know so far
content: Former President Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris will engage in their first presidential debate on September 10, setting the stage for the upcoming general election on November 5. Hosted by ABC News at the National Constitution Center in Philadelphia, this debate will be vital for both candidates to sway undecided voters and cement their support base.
summary: Former President Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris will engage in their first presidential debate on September 10, setting the stage for the upcoming general election on November 5. Hosted by ABC News at the National Constitution Center in Philadelphia, this debate will be vital for both candidates to sway undecided voters and cement their support base.

title: Las Vegas politician Robert Telles found guilty of murdering investigative journalist
content: A Clark County jury convicted former Las Vegas politician Robert Telles of murdering investigative journalist Jeff German, who reported misconduct in Telles' department. German's article detailed a toxic work environment, which played a role in Telles losing his reelection bid. Telles faces sentencing for first-degree murder with aggravating factors, potentially leading to life imprisonment.
summary: A Clark County jury convicted former Las Vegas politician Robert Telles of murdering investigative journalist Jeff German, who reported misconduct in Telles' department. German's article detailed a toxic work environment, which played a role in Telles losing his reelection bid. Telles faces sentencing for first-degree murder with aggravating factors, potentially leading to life imprisonment.

title: Prince Harry parts ways with Meghan Markle (temporarily) after King Charles’ emotional appeal
content: Prince Harry plans a solo visit to New York, leaving Meghan Markle behind. The journey is an attempt to reconnect with his father, King Charles, and highlight his dedication to causes such as African Parks, The HALO Trust, The Diana Award, and Travalyst. Meghan fully supports his efforts.
summary: Prince Harry plans a solo visit to New York, leaving Meghan Markle behind. The journey is an attempt to reconnect with his father, King Charles, and highlight his dedication to causes such as African Parks, The HALO Trust, The Diana Award, and Travalyst. Meghan fully supports his efforts.

title: US elections: Why is Kamala Harris bringing running mate Tim Walz to her first big interview? ‘She can’t get through it without a babysitter’
content: Kamala Harris, the Democratic presidential nominee, will have her first major interview since her nomination, joined by running mate Tim Walz. Critics claim this shows a lack of confidence, while supporters say it demonstrates unity. The pivotal interview's outcome could shape Harris's campaign.
summary: Kamala Harris, the Democratic presidential nominee, will have her first major interview since her nomination, joined by running mate Tim Walz. Critics claim this shows a lack of confidence, while supporters say it demonstrates unity. The pivotal interview's outcome could shape Harris's campaign.

title: Experts warn Prince Harry’s memoir re-release could reignite royal feud
content: Prince Harry's memoir, Spare, is set for a paperback release on October 24, the same day as King Charles's Commonwealth summit in Samoa. Royal experts are concerned this timing could revive tensions within the family. The release, without new content, may attract more readers, potentially overshadowing the King's commitments and reigniting controversy.
summary: Prince Harry's memoir, Spare, is set for a paperback release on October 24, the same day as King Charles's Commonwealth summit in Samoa. Royal experts are concerned this timing could revive tensions within the family. The release, without new content, may attract more readers, potentially overshadowing the King's commitments and reigniting controversy.

title: Florida sheriff slams Washington DC lawmakers after illegal immigrants arrested for $7,300 palmetto berry theft
content: Last week, eight individuals, including four illegal immigrants, were arrested in Florida for allegedly stealing $7,300 worth of palmetto berries. The suspects loaded around 9,000 pounds of berries into a U-Hau. Brevard County Sheriff Wayne Ivey publicly criticised Washington DC lawmakers for their failure to enforce border security, emphasising that illegal immigration leads to further crimes. Ivey noted that some suspects had previously been deported and expressed frustration over the inability to deport individuals with pending court dates or nonviolent crimes.
summary: Last week, eight individuals, including four illegal immigrants, were arrested in Florida for allegedly stealing $7,300 worth of palmetto berries. The suspects loaded around 9,000 pounds of berries into a U-Hau. Brevard County Sheriff Wayne Ivey publicly criticised Washington DC lawmakers for their failure to enforce border security, emphasising that illegal immigration leads to further crimes. Ivey noted that some suspects had previously been deported and expressed frustration over the inability to deport individuals with pending court dates or nonviolent crimes.

title: Former Neveda politician Robert Telles convicted of murdering Las Vegas journalist
content: Former county official Robert Telles has been convicted of murdering veteran journalist Jeff German after German published articles critical of him. The incident occurred in September 2022, outside German's home. Despite Telles's claims of being framed, DNA and video evidence implicated him. The jury's decision is seen as justice for German, who spent his career addressing issues like political corruption. The case highlights the peril journalists face while holding officials accountable.
summary: Former county official Robert Telles has been convicted of murdering veteran journalist Jeff German after German published articles critical of him. The incident occurred in September 2022, outside German's home. Despite Telles's claims of being framed, DNA and video evidence implicated him. The jury's decision is seen as justice for German, who spent his career addressing issues like political corruption. The case highlights the peril journalists face while holding officials accountable.

title: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov charged in France for alleged criminal activity on platform
content: French investigative judges have charged Telegram CEO Pavel Durov, a French citizen, with preliminary offenses related to criminal activities on his messaging app. Durov faces allegations of enabling child sexual abuse material and drug trafficking while obstructing investigations. Durov had co-founded Telegram with his brother after facing pressure from Russian authorities
summary: French investigative judges have charged Telegram CEO Pavel Durov, a French citizen, with preliminary offenses related to criminal activities on his messaging app. Durov faces allegations of enabling child sexual abuse material and drug trafficking while obstructing investigations. Durov had co-founded Telegram with his brother after facing pressure from Russian authorities

title: US supreme court declines to lift block on Biden’s student loan repayment plan
content: The US supreme court has decided against lifting the block on President Biden's student loan repayment plan. The plan, paused due to legal challenges, would lower monthly payments and expedite loan forgiveness. Borrowers in the SAVE program are currently in interest-free forbearance, while the legal proceedings continue in lower courts to determine the plan's future.
summary: The US supreme court has decided against lifting the block on President Biden's student loan repayment plan. The plan, paused due to legal challenges, would lower monthly payments and expedite loan forgiveness. Borrowers in the SAVE program are currently in interest-free forbearance, while the legal proceedings continue in lower courts to determine the plan's future.

title: Trump shooter spent months searching for target before choosing him, reveals FBI
content: The FBI disclosed that Thomas Crooks, 20, attempted to assassinate Donald Trump at a July rally in Pennsylvania after extensive research on both Trump and Biden. Nearly 1,000 interviews were conducted, but Crooks' motive remains unclear. Authorities highlighted his mixed ideologies and focus on opportunistic targets. An FBI official said that the suspected shooter exhibited a mix of ideologies and did not align strictly with either right-leaning or left-leaning views.
summary: The FBI disclosed that Thomas Crooks, 20, attempted to assassinate Donald Trump at a July rally in Pennsylvania after extensive research on both Trump and Biden. Nearly 1,000 interviews were conducted, but Crooks' motive remains unclear. Authorities highlighted his mixed ideologies and focus on opportunistic targets. An FBI official said that the suspected shooter exhibited a mix of ideologies and did not align strictly with either right-leaning or left-leaning views.
